name: Verify button visibility based on user role
scenarioId: permissions:Verify button visibility based on user role
methodName: Verify button visibility based on user role

testSteps.description: 1: Verify button visibility based on user role ({user=carlos.santana@example.com, password=medico1234, visibility=should})

children.description: Given the user "carlos.santana@example.com" with password "medico1234" logs in to the system
When he is on the schedules page
Then he should see the "Bloqueos" and "Lista" buttons

testSteps.description: 2: Verify button visibility based on user role ({user=pepo@mail.com, password=123456, visibility=should})

children.description: Given the user "pepo@mail.com" with password "123456" logs in to the system
When he is on the schedules page
Then he should see the "Bloqueos" and "Lista" buttons

testSteps.description: 3: Verify button visibility based on user role ({user=juan@mail.com, password=123456, visibility=should})

children.description: Given the user "juan@mail.com" with password "123456" logs in to the system
When he is on the schedules page
Then he should see the "Bloqueos" and "Lista" buttons

userStory.narrative:
As an administrator
  I want to ensure only authorized users see the schedule modification buttons

title: Verify button visibility based on user role

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
Given the user "<user>" with password "<password>" logs in to the system
When he is on the schedules page
Then he <visibility> see the "Bloqueos" and "Lista" buttons
